Good game but it has one of the hardest mission.

I spent way too much time trying to acquire the gnome achievement, but luckily I got it in my first play-through. As for the review, honestly this is as good as Half-Life 2, but if you haven't played Half-Life 2 or HL2 Episode: 1, I'd recommend playing those so you can know everything. Compared to Half Life 2, I've found that there's more opportunities such as using caterpillars to gain health and the hunter's unique ability to flechette it's enemies and be killed with its own flechettes using a tire. My favorite part about this game is it's replay value. You can load the same savegame and still finish the scene in a different way than you did before. I also like how you can drive, unlike you could in EPISODE 1, but that has also kind of overwhelmed me on my first playthrough since I didn't want the gnome to get lost and he rolls around. However, the ENDING of this game is okay I guess. Dropping off the gnome into space felt good, but the finale kind of felt bland.

Overall Half-Life 2: Episode Two gets an 8/10 from me.

Episode Two mě bavila daleko víc jako one,dle mě lepší příběh,více akce a prostředí příjemnější.jen škoda,že obě epizody jsou krátké.Doufejme,že se dočkáme i pokračování,sice vždy dlouho trvá,než dají další díl Half Life,ale pak to stojí zato.Tyto legendy není třeba představovat a určitě doporučím zahráním komplet série.

Co można napisać jest to Half-Life nazwa znana chyba wszystkim graczom. Klasyk pełen napięcia i nieoczekiwanych zmian akcji. Ma wspaniałą dynamikę i niespecjalne wymagania. Pozwala grać z satysfakcją osobom, które nie są "mistrzami jednego strzału" usatysfakcjonuje zarówno początkujących jak i wyjadaczy.

Another great entry to the series, and unfortunately the last one. Rip in pepperoni Half-Life I suppose.

I still think it's worse than Episode 1 though, and I suppose that's where my review will differ from many others. I found the game far more like the "parade of constant obstacles" that the vortigaunt was talking about. Parts like Chapter 2 are tiresome, if original in their visual design. The aim is to get to White Forest to do the most important thing in all human history, and you spend two hours down some mine shaft or getting caught by the combine for the 548th time. The driving is almost pointless as you never actually get any momentum in driving. By that I mean:

- Any "long drive" is actually less than a minute before you have to stop somewhere else and get out the car immediately. If you had actually just driven the whole way to White Forest from the bridge with no obstacles it would have taken about three or four minutes I'm sure.
- The car stops when you hit most obstacles. A little frustrating when careering around the country, but 100x more frustrating when you're attacking the Hunters at the end. I had to ghost-save a lot towards the end just to replay hitting those Hunters with the car.

So yes, whilst of course I would recommend this fabulous game, I had more criticisms of it than I did of Episode 1, definitely.

Что же может быть лучше старой доброй Халф-Лайф? Лично меня очень порадовала именно эта часть. Бегать и стрелять стало гораздо удобнее, благодаря обновленной игре.  Осталась всеми любимая гравитационная пушка, по-моему самое веселое оружие в игре. Миссии не однотипны, разнообразие есть, и это радует. Еще один плюс это сюжет. Хорошее продолжение предыдущей части. Думаю эта игра заслуживает внимания. 

Итоговая оценка: 9/10.
